answers.answer: Hi, your symptoms of headache and nausea could be due to the weather, unaccustomed and sudden. Also, the exercise and the sudden intake of fluids could sometimes cause mild disturbances with electrolyte balance. When you exercise in hot weather try to add a little bit of salt to water. Sometimes hypoglycemia also can cause headaches and nausea. Were your blood counts normal? if anemia has been ruled out, then metabolic disorders like Diabetes Mellitus and Hypothyroidism could cause the symptoms described by you. A simple blood test could help detect diabetes and hypothyroidism. Consult your primary care physician for these tests. Regards.

question: anxiety and to much water? urgent help?i have really bad anxiety and i been feeling bad for 2 months with dizziness fatigue and headaches i had a lot of test done witch came back clear but today i felt good and decided to skate bored a little for like 3 hours i drank like 2 bottles of water and a Gatorade it was also hot right now i came home and sat down and i had a really bad headache and it feels like i drank to much water and i have a little nausea should i got to the er?
title: to much water over excersion ?
